citation.article-title: Spiroplasma sabaudiense sp. nov. from mosquitoes collected in France.

p.s: Description of Spiroplasma sabaudiense sp. nov.
Spiroplasma sabaudiense (sa.bau.dien.se. L. neut. adj. Sabaudiensis, of Sabaudia, an ancient country of Gaul, corresponding to present day Savoy, referring to the geographic origin of the isolate)
Helical filaments 100 to 160 nm in diameter and 3.1 to 3.8 μm long.
The cells lack true cell walls and periplasmic fibrils.
Colonies on solid medium supplemented with 1.6% Noble agar are diffuse, rarely exhibiting central zones of growth into agar, with numerous satellite colonies.
Does not hemadsorb guinea pig erythrocytes.
Isolated from female Aedes sp. mosquitoes in Savoy, France.
The guanine-plus-cytosine content of the deoxyribonucleic acid is 30 ± 1 mol%.
Serologically distinct from the type and representative strains of groups I through XI.
